title: What is the furthest star ever observed? - Quora

response.answer_text: When we see distant galaxies all we’re actually seeing is the light from the many stars in each, so over 10 billion light years away. The farthest individual star ever seen is Icarus or MACS J1149+2223. It’s only visible because it is being magnified by the gravity of a massive galaxy cluster. (lensing’). It’s about half that distance away.
Look at the sky Nd think to yourself, is this the furthest I can see. By all technicality, as long as you look up, you have by all means observed the stars. Just not up close.
